name: treatment of wastewater from potato starch production, wastewater treatment | heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25652/documentation

This dataset represents the treatment of a wastewater, generated from an ordinary transforming activity. Purification in wastewater treatment of 'wastewater from potato starch production'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used for wastewaters, generated from ordinary transforming activities, of equal or similar composition. The wastewater has a content of TOC: 0.51291 kg/m3, COD: 1.99965 kg/m3 and BOD: 0.96713 kg/m3. TOC is equal to C present in the wastewater, COD is calculated as TOC/0.2565 and BOD is calculated as COD/0.53034. Detailed elemental composition can be found in the properties of the wastewater treated. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 100%.

The activity starts with the wastewater being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the wastewater to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the wastewater being treated and waste-specific emissions released to the environment. Expenditures from treatment of wastewater in waste treatment plant are included as well as relevant infrastructure of the plant. Emissions from any sludge digestion, biogas generation and utilization (heeding specific wastewater composition) are also included. Waste-specific direct emissions of untreated wastewater and required territory-specific infrastructure for sewers are not contained within this dataset but instead in the regional market datasets for this wastewater.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 16.743579766537 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1250.84108527132 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 460.58904958214 mm/year. In the WWT plant, 0% of its water input are lost due to evaporation from pools, 0.0253% of water is *gained* from organic mass degradation, and 0.0117% is removed off site via sludge disposal. (References: UN data, 2020. Precipitation, Environment Statistics Database, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?q=precipitation&d=ENV&f=variableID%3a6; World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2; Doka G.,2021. A model for composition-specific life cycle inventories of regionalised wastewater fates, Zurich, Switzerland. http://www.doka.ch/publications.htm)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for the disposal of a selected wastewater in Global. The reference unit is 1 m3 wastewater input. This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a supranational region average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 82.2 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 8.2%-41.2%-50.6%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 0.2211292 kg O. The digestion process produces 49.35646 litres of biogas with an energy content of 1.1391615MJ. 60.5% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 0.3322kg DM.

exchanges.description: net heat output from digester gas utilization in wastewater treatment plant.

flow.name: heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas
